document.docAuthor: Sun, Xin, Zhang, Bing & Wu, Donghui
document.docTitle: Protaphorura minima Sun, Zhang & Wu, 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species and one new country record of Protaphorura Absolon, 1901 (Collembola: Onychiuridae) from northeast China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species and one new country record of Protaphorura Absolon, 1901 (Collembola: Onychiuridae) from northeast China

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 35 – 42. Protaphorura minima sp. nov. 35, dorsal chaetotaxy; 36, PAO; 37, ventral side of head; 38 – 39, Th. I tergum; 40, chaetotaxy of Abd. IV sternum; 41, female genital plate; 42, male genital plate. Scales: 0.1 mm (35, 37, 40), 0.01 mm (36, 38 – 39, 41 – 42).
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 43 – 46. Protaphorura minima sp. nov. 43, posterior chaetae row of Abd. I tergum; 44, central part of Abd. V tergum; 45, anal valves (male); 46, anal valves (female). Scales: 0.01 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype female, 16 paratype females and 6 paratype males on slides, China : Heilongjiang: Tongjiang: Honghe (
47 ° 35 ’ N
,
133 ° 31 ’ E
),
27 Aug. 2010
, litter and soil, Wu Donghui et al . leg.
Description. Body color white in alcohol. Size 1.0–1.35 mm in females, 0.9–1.0 mm in males; holotype 1.0 mm. Body slender and elongated.

Pseudocellar formula dorsally: 33 /012/ 33332 , absent ventrally (
Figs 35 & 37
); subcoxa 1 of legs without pso. Parapseudocellar formula ventrally: 00/000/ 100000 ; subcoxa 1 of legs without psx. Pseudopores formula dorsally: 00/011/
111100
, ventrally: 00/ 111 /00xx00 (
Figs 35, 37 & 40
).

Appendages. Subcoxa 1 of legs I–III with 4, 4 and 4 chaetae, subcoxa 2 with 1, 4 and 4 chaetae, respectively. Tibiotarsi of legs I–III with 22 ( 11, 8 , 3 ), 21 ( 11, 8 , 2 ) and 23 ( 11, 8 , 4 ) chaetae, respectively. Unguis with small inner denticle. Unguiculus slender and pointed, 1.2 times as long as inner edge of unguis, without inner basal lamella.
Etymology. The name of the new species refers to its small body size.
Ecology. Found under a pine tree in the Sanjiang Experimental Station of Wetland Ecology, Chinese Academy of Sciences.

Remarks. The new species is particular in having the male ventral organ on Abd. VI sternum (two brushshaped chaetae on each anal valve). Among other species of the genus
Protaphorura
,
P. ajudagi
,
P. christiani Pomorski, Leithner & Bruckner, 2003
,
P. januarii (Weiner, 1977 )
,
P. kopetdagi Pomorski, 1994
, P. s t i r i a c a (Stach, 1946 ) and
P. stogovi Pomorski, 1993
also have the male ventral organ, but they can be easily separated by the combined characters in
Table 1
.
